image.altText: Close up of flowers, candles and shoes with a framed picture in the background.

props.synopsis: Large crowds gathered at a Bondi synagogue this morning for the funeral of a prominent rabbi who was killed in Sunday's terror attack. Follow live.

title.children: Bondi terror victims mourned

image.altText: A police officer holds a gun while standing at the gates of the Adelaide Oval during the third Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: South Australian Police will be carrying rifles and exercising additional weapon and drug search powers at Adelaide Oval during the Third Ashes Test, following the Bondi terror attack on Sunday.

title.children: Police presence increased at Adelaide Oval Ashes Test in wake of Bondi shooting

image.altText: A screen shot of a Tamika talking to the camera, long blonde hair, flowers in the hair, low-cut dress, crystal chandelier.

props.synopsis: Police are still waiting to examine a large volume of evidence, including a a post-mortem report in the "complex" alleged murder case involving Tamika Chesser, a court has heard.

title.children: Former Beauty and the Geek contestant's murder case adjourned

image.altText: A woman kneels next to a massive washed up ray on a sandy beach with another few dead rays behind her.

props.synopsis: Dead rays and sharks found along a regional South Australia beach have been linked to the algal bloom, the government confirms.

title.children: Deaths of rays and sharks blamed on algal bloom

image.altText: Two sea lion pups with one draped over the other

props.synopsis: Australia's sea lion population has had a tough winter with rising pup mortalities amid the algal bloom, but dedicated researchers are doing everything they can to help their survival as a species.

title.children: Hope for Australia's sea lions amid more pup deaths

image.altText: A large white truck with SES decals and a boat trailer behind in a car park

props.synopsis: A 67-year-old Victorian man has been found dead, and a 74-year-old Victorian man is still missing in waters off Cape Jaffa after they failed to return from fishing.

title.children: Search for missing experienced fisher after companion's body found

image.altText: Australia batter Usman Khawaja plays a sweep shot as England wicketkeeper Jamie Smith looks on from behind the stumps.

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins walks to the crease as Australia sputters after Usman Khawaja's impressive 82 on day one of the third Ashes Test at the Adelaide Oval. Follow live.

title.children: England into the tail as Australia loses momentum once more in Adelaide

image.altText: A man wearing a dark suit and shirt is sitting and looking directly at the camera. Behind him is a board room table and chairs

props.synopsis: After 13 years serving as South Australia's top judge, Chief Justice Chris Kourakis says it is "an appropriate time to retire".

title.children: SA's top judge Chris Kourakis retires

image.altText: A older man in a pageboy's cap and suit stands behind microphones and next to two people in suits

props.synopsis: A Holocaust survivor says the Bondi terror attack should be "a wake-up call" for the nation as the South Australian government double its funding for education programs.

title.children: SA government doubles Holocaust education funding after Bondi attack

image.altText: A generic image of soccer balls inside a net.

props.synopsis: An outbreak of the flu has delayed an upcoming A-League Women's match between Adelaide United and Melbourne City, as South Australia grapples with a record number of cases.

title.children: A-League Women's match postponed due to flu outbreak

image.altText: Four small children sit inside the inner rim of the wheel of large piece of yellow farm machinery.

props.synopsis: A group dedicated to Australian grain farming created more than a decade ago has just cracked 100,000 followers with about 20,000 people following from overseas.

title.children: Farmers flock to online group to connect during the highs and lows

image.altText: Merry Christmas Christmas lights on a house.

props.synopsis: With the push of a smartphone button, those watching Luke Denton's Christmas light display in Blackwood can add their own splashes of colour, or even turn the whole thing off.

title.children: Interactive Christmas lights giving children the 'power' from Adelaide foothills

image.altText: A white car, behind a police tape, a blue tent is set up behind.

props.synopsis: Barkindji mother-of-two Sonya Dutton, 31, was found in her family's Wilcannia residence on March 29, 2022 — four days after she was reportedly last seen.

title.children: 'Unanswered questions' despite inquest into mum found dead in backyard

image.altText: The old bank at the township of Snowtown.

props.synopsis: Snowtown serial killer James Vlassakis will remain behind bars, after the South Australian Parole Board's decision to release him was overturned.

title.children: 'Risk to community' if Snowtown murderer was to be released, parole review finds

image.altText: Exterior of a modern hospital

props.synopsis: The number of critical patients having to travel interstate to receive CAR T-cell therapy will be reduced from mid-next year, with SA to launch a service at the Royal Adelaide Hospital.

title.children: Cutting-edge cancer therapy coming to South Australia from mid-2026

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Katy Gallagher stand behind podiums at a press conference in an indoor room

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers and Finance Minister Katy Gallagher hand down their first budget update since the 2025 federal election.

title.children: Short-term spending rises despite overall budget improvement

image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: Tom Silvagni, son of former AFL star Stephen Silvagni, will have to serve at least three years and three months of his sentence.

title.children: Tom Silvagni, son of AFL star, sentenced to six years' jail for rape

image.altText: A close up image of donald trump speaking at the wihte house

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump's move comes a week after the United States seized a sanctioned oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela.

title.children: Trump orders Venezuela oil blockade, labelling it a 'terrorist' regime

image.altText: RBA sign behind market graphics

props.synopsis: Major bank economics teams are rushing to change their cash rate calls ahead of next year. The ASX drops for its third straight day as it follows a mostly negative session on Wall Street, while the price of oil has drops to its lowest level in four years. Follow live.

title.children: Westpac removes rate cut call, now sees RBA on 'extended hold' in 2026

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Iron ore at one-week high, helped by improved spot market liquidity

image.altText: Smoke and flames over farmland.

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old farmer dies helping fight a fire in Mindarabin, in WA's Great Southern region.

title.children: Falling tree kills farmer tackling blaze in WA's south

image.altText: close up of child's foot playing with soccer ball on the grass

props.synopsis: Many parents are aware posting photos of their children online comes with risk. But it's not only images that can be harmful for your child.

title.children: Why photos are not the most harmful thing we share about our kids online

image.altText: A screenshot from a security camera shows a masked man walking along a street. A blue circle is around him.

props.synopsis: Police say the footage shows the suspect "casing" the area around the campus before the attack.

title.children: FBI releases footage of Brown University shooting suspect

image.altText: Nick Reiner on the red carpet in September 2025

props.synopsis: Prosecutors will charge the son of film director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner with two counts of murder.

title.children: Nick Reiner to be charged over Rob Reiner's death

image.altText: Exterior of the fitzroy community school - a brick building painted with a mural of rolling fields with a sunset

props.synopsis: The school that inspired author John Marsden is facing potential legal action from parents over allegations of physical abuse.

title.children: Parents threaten legal action over abuse allegations at 'cult-like' school

image.altText: An empty and dirty glass mineral water bottle held up in a forest.

props.synopsis: Searchers find a water bottle and a garbage bag that may have been used as a poncho in the Tasmanian bushland where Belgian tourist Celine Cremer went missing.

title.children: 'Potential shelter' found in bushland search for Celine Cremer

image.altText: CSIRO sign generic

props.synopsis: Just a month after announcing 350 job cuts, the CSIRO has received a funding boost, but proposed job cuts will still happen, the national science agency says.

title.children: CSIRO receives $233m funding boost but up to 350 jobs still to go

image.altText: A man with a neutral expression looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: A judge at the Old Bailey rules Ioan Alexandru-Pintaru, who stabbed a young Australian girl in Leicester Square last year, will be detained at a mental hospital indefinitely.

title.children: Man who stabbed 11yo Aussie tourist in London to be detained indefinitely

image.altText: Terence Crawford celebrates with both arms aloft

props.synopsis: Multi-division, undefeated world champion Terence Crawford has called time on his legendary boxing career and will hang up the gloves at age 38.

title.children: The best boxer in the world just retired at the peak of his powers

image.altText: A woman with short stands in front of the base of a large spotted gum looking friendly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Thought to be 500 years old, a 70-metre-tall spotted gum is almost hidden in the middle of a South Coast state forest. Conservationists want the "world champion" tree and the forest it lives in recognised and celebrated.

title.children: Push to recognise home of 70-metre-tall 'world champion' spotted gum

image.altText: Three CFA officers and one police officer stand at the edge of a burnt house crime scene.

props.synopsis: A man who pleaded guilty to arson after lighting a fire that killed his housemate has been jailed for 11 years. A Supreme Court justice said his actions were "extremely dangerous" and unsophisticated.

title.children: Arsonist sentenced to 11 years in prison for fire that killed housemate

image.altText: A police car.

props.synopsis: A man is in custody following the fatal assault of a man in Cheltenham on Tuesday night.

title.children: Man arrested after fatal assault in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: A composite image of three men

props.synopsis: Marathon talks between the US and Ukraine led to "not perfect" but "very workable" framework that could bring to an end Russia's near four-year-old invasion, the Ukrainian president says.

title.children: Ukraine peace deal could be presented to Russia within days: Zelenskyy

image.altText: GettyImages-2250489091

props.synopsis: Cameron Green earns a massive payday on the eve of the Adelaide Test, creating history in the Indian Premier League.

title.children: Aussie makes history as highest-priced overseas IPL player in record deal

image.altText: GettyImages-2244892355

props.synopsis: FIFA backtracks on high-priced World Cup tickets, with a limited amount of seats to be made available for less than $100.

title.children: FIFA offers pool of lower-priced World Cup tickets following backlash

image.altText: outside of unit block, fire on bottom well lit

props.synopsis: Four people remain in hospital with minor injuries after jumping for their lives from a burning apartment building.

title.children: Four people jump for their lives from burning apartment block
